titleStmt.title: Letter, James L. Dodds in France, to Ellen Smith, in Jackson, Tenn., 1919 Feb. 14

publicationStmt.publisher: The University of Tennessee Libraries Digital Initiatives

availability.p: The copyright interests in this collection remain with the creator. For more information, contact the Special Collections Library.

bibl.title: Letter, James L. Dodds in France, to Ellen Smith, in Jackson, Tenn., 1919 Feb. 14

projectDesc.p: Machine-readable transcription created for the University of Tennessee Libraries Special Collections.

editorialDecl.p: Errors in transcription of the printed text not controlled.
Editorial tags limited to gap and unclear.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

revisionDesc.change: Approximate date of original transcription and transcriber.
Migrating from P4 to validated TEI P5.

div.p: Will write you a few lines this evening to say I am fine and dandy.
I havent had a letter from you in about ten days.
But there is some mail coming in to night and maybe will have one in it
We are having some pretty days now. Although there is snow on the ground but the sun shines warm.
I am afraid to say much about the weather for fear will be bad again.
We are expecting to have a good feed tomorrow night we chiped in and are going to have beer, wine and
you know that will be quite a treat to us.
you know I kindly like my beer and sandwichs I sure expect to eat some when I get home.

My Aunt said she was going to give me a big supper now wont I mop up with that were I havent found Lim yet the 19 is scattered all over the country. I see some of the boys most ever day and I always ask about him but no one seems to know where he is. I am going out to his camp ay and see if they know any thing about him well what is going on in Jaxon, I sure wish I was
there so could go to some good dances. Now I dont see why you dont make Bob take you some time.
He could be a wall flower while you had a good time suppose you try that and see how will work.
Will how is the flue by this time? I hope it is better for I dont want to come home some of these days and have the flue and die
That would be awful to live through all this and then happen to bad luck.
I dont know wheather will be here in this town much longer or not Some seem to think we will move before long
I dont have the least idea where we will go but I hope it will be home.
Although I dont believe we'll be a home going trip
Well Ellen I dont know an thing to write about these days for there is nothing doing at all
So will quit for this time write me real after and tell me all the news you know
